revised_title: Cortical Processing of Phenomenal Motion in Artificial Intra-ocular Lenses
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine if phenomenal motion in Leviant's Enigma figure is generated by the eye or the cerebral cortex. They found that patients with artificial intra-ocular lenses could perceive motion in the figure, supporting the idea that activity in specific visual areas of the cerebral cortex endows the figure with its phenomenal properties of motion.
